inn1.comm: starts short outside off stump, sticks in the pitch a little, de Kock goes for the pull and mistimes it back to the bowler
short of a length on leg stump, clipped off his thigh pad to long leg
good length outside off, 132kph/82mph, zips nicely off the surface through to the keeper
fuller, wider outside off, left alone
lures him into a drive this time, reaching away from his body without much footwork, flies off a thick outside edge down to third man
wrong line, doesn't adjust to the left hander, on the pads and worked behind square
like Young, the first ball is short outside off, and again de Kock is early on his shot and gets a bottom edge into the pitch
nice delivery, back of a length outside off, good carry through to the keeper as Bavuma holds the bat inside the line
fuller, at off stump, defended to backward point
this nips back a touch off the seam, takes an inside edge into the pads

dropped!, an early chance goes bagging for Ireland, Bavuma driving without footwork again and a thick edge bursts through Kevin O'Brien's hands at second slip. Went quite quickly, and had to move a little to his left, but got to hold those
goes for a cut, gets a bottom edge past the stumps
takes the pad towards square leg
full at middle and off, driven to the covers

clears long leg...just! A short ball, he goes for the hook, sails towards the boundary where the fielder is a little in off the rope and the leap is to no avail. Have to be on the rope, although may still not have caught it
shoved down the leg side, called wide
poor ball, full toss wide outside off, de Kock drives it sweetly square through the off side
back of a length at middle and off, defended to the on side
defended from off stump towards midwicket
back of a length at off stump, driven into the off side from the back foot
width outside off, de Kock throws his hands through a square drive and the ball runs down to third man
beats the edge with a short-of-a-length delivery which Bavuma tries to force off the back foot...he's looked uncertain outside off stump
fuller, outside off, he comes forward to drive, still not convincing footwork, takes a thickish outside edge and squirts towards gully
full at the stumps, 133kph/82mph, driven to the covers
nicely bowled, short of a length on off stump, Bavuma pulls his bat inside the line and there's good carry to the keeper
on middle and off, tucked to the leg side
that's a nicely timed straight drive, initially it didn't seem he struck it cleanly, came slightly across the ball, but it whistles off the bat straight down the ground. Fast outfield
flicked sweetly off the pads but picks out square leg
back of a length, tapped to the covers
full outside off, and another sweet piece of timing and placement from de Kock, leans forward into the half volley and places it between cover and mid-off
and again! Two in a row and three in the over. Overpitched again, outside off, de Kock drives it hard into the pitch and it rockets past a diving cover
defends a length ball square to the off side
beats the edge again, trying to force this off the back foot, wasn't that short, playing away from his body. His feet are stuck around middle and leg
pushed down the leg side, a big wide
wide outside off this time, Bavuma throws his bat at it and almost loses balance in the crease...doesn't make contact
beaten again, goes under the bat this time, Bavuma is struggling...there was some width, but he was again static in the crease
on the stumps, holds his shape, defends to the off side

well bowled, Bavuma does well to keep this down, short of a length outside off and it rises to take a thick outside edge but Bavuma is able to take his bottom hand off the bat which sends it towards ground as it goes wide of second slip
starts with a full delivery outside off, driven towards mid-off who should have cut this off having made the ground to his left but lets the ball scoot underneath him
full at off stump, driven straight to mid-off
that's full and floaty, help yourself outside off, Bavuma latches on with a strong cover drive which threads the gap...better footwork this time
straighter delivery, not quite so full, driven with more confidence to mid-off
drags the length back, 122kph/75mph, defended towards the bowler who shows his footballing skills much to the appreciation of the crowd
leans forward and defends to the covers
full, hint of swing, but pushed down the leg side and that's another wide...starting to stack up already
dragged down short, de Kock swivels on a nicely-timed pull but sends it straight to deep square leg
back of a length, defended to the leg side
on off stump, Bavuma opens the face a touch and places it into space on the off side
touch too straight, de Kock able to whip it off his his pads to deep square
full and straight, nudged to the leg side, for a moment they aren't sure about the single but it's safe enough in the end
uses his wrists, takes this from around off stump and works it behind square on the leg side
full and straight, more runs behind square on the leg side...brings up the fifty stand in good time
just a fraction short from Murtagh, sits up nicely and Bavuma is quickly onto it with a handsome pull, in the air, in front of square
worked off the front foot this time, taken from outside off through midwicket
back of a length at off stump, opens the face and runs it behind point
tucked off his pads into midwicket
comes forward, drives, the ball runs towards midwicket

short and that's very nicely played by de Kock who looks in very good order, takes this from around middle and off, rolls his wrists over the ball to keep it down, and pulls it wide of short fine leg inside the circle
overcompensates by sending this wide outside off, but de Kock's flaying drive finds cover
short again, that won't worry de Kock at this pace, pulls strongly to deep square leg
full outside off, 133kph/82mph, left alone
and now it's Bavuma on the pull! That's high and handsome over deep backward square. Short, he has all the time in the world, deliberately gets underneath the ball to hit it up and over the rope
fuller, worked to midwicket
round the wicket, pushed across outside off, de Kock drives and it slices off the outer part of the bat but falls short of backward point
flicked along the ground through midwicket
doesn't adjust to the right hander, shoves this onto the pads, Bavuma gets down to sweep and gets it fine of short fine leg...very nicely controlled stroke
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
better delivery, on middle and off, defended with bat and pad together
full outside off, driven to the covers
uses his feet, comes down on the line of leg stump, which opens up the off side, drives a wide delivery to deep cover.
some extra bounce here, causes a problem, Bavuma whips his bottom hand off the bat. Smacked the glove
driven at the top of the bounce through the off side
on the pads, too many of those today, flicked down to fine leg
beats the top edge as Bavuma looks to play this through the off side, just swung away a fraction and bounced a touch. Playing away from his body
steers this down to third man with an open face
on the pads, punched to deep midwicket
goes for the sweep, gets taken on the pad, a strangled appeal for lbw, more by the keeper
late cuts to backward point
short outside off, de Kock goes back and drives in front of square to the cover sweeper
touch too short again, Bavuma plays it off the back foot down to long-off
cut off the back foot square through point
strong wrists on show as he whips this off his pads to deep midwicket
a short delivery, he rocks back and pulls through midwicket, not quite out of the middle as the bat twists in his hands
almost gets into a tangle here, looking to come forward and pull to the leg side, the ball pops and he nearly spoons it in the air
width outside off, a late cut to third man
full outside off, runs it down to third man
on the pads at 123kph/75mph, de Kock aims to work it away but misses out and the ball bobbles to the leg side
comes forward, opens the face and deftly taps to the off side...good rotation of the strike
short, gives him plenty of time to go back towards leg stump, drives out to deep cover
poor delivery, slung down the leg side, Bavuma misses his pull but gets the wide
full, driven down to long-off
pushed across outside off from round the wicket, a nicely-placed square drive which allows a second run to deep point
drives in front of square this time to the cover sweeper
dragged down short, a gentle delivery, Bavuma uses his crease, rocks back deep, then pulls powerfully over midwicket
full at off stump, defended down by his feet
another short ball and another boundary, de Kock latches onto a pull which skims to the deep square-leg boundary and it takes him to a serene fifty off 42 balls
worked off the pads behind square...that's excellent running to make it a second
tucked from off stump behind square on the leg side
back-of-a-length on off stump, whipped to deep midwicket
nice touch from de Kock, was thinking of something more powerful to start with but ends up just dabbing down to third man
over the wicket, taken from outside off into square leg
round the wicket, on the pads, flicked into the leg side
short outside off, can't find the gap as he takes this to the leg side...the bowler himself gets across
short outside off, sits up, de Kock cracks it in front of square through the covers. The sweeper had no chance
too short again, but this time it's just a single to deep cover
and Bavuma also able to play off the back foot, driven square to deep cover
length ball outside off, bit of width and Bavuma guides it down to third man for his fifty on debut, taking advantage of that drop early on - O'Brien the man in the slips on that occasion
shortish, slightly leg side and de Kock flips one more behind square
tight lines from KOB, Bavuma scoops it short into the leg side
medium-dobble outside off, wristily chopped past backward point but they won't get a second to third man
touch back of a length and Quinny swipes another single off his hip
slightly short again, in the channel, tapped down towards point
starts with a half-tracker, Bavuma swats it imperiously on the pull in front of deep midwicket for four
dug in again, goes for the pull but this time miscues towards square leg
back of a length on the body, Bavuma nudges behind square and scampers back for two
pitched up outside off, 135kph and driven crisply, taken by extra cover on the bounce
shortish outside off, angles the bat and chops to backward point
back of a length and Bavuma rides the bounce outside off to dab one to third man
length ball on off stump, Bavuma drops into the off side and thinks about one, has to quickly head back to his ground
back of a length, stays low as Bavuma pulls and gets a bottom edge on to his knee roll
round the wicket, short ball and de Kock pulls, was that a bottom edge? The stump mic picked up a thin, woody sound but it went through Wilson's gloves and hit him on the chest. Tough chance
short again, this time cut through backward point for one
pitched up on middle and off, Bavuma punches back past the bowler but mid-on prevents a single
short ball, 120kph outside off, slapped through point but there's a man out there - quiet over, Ireland need a few of those
back of a length in the channel outside off, Bavuma cuts but Porterfield swoops on it at backward point
comes across and flays a drive on the up through the covers to the sweeper
round the wicket, 134kph outside off, gets a bottom edge on the cut
touch short, Bavuma pokes into the covers
short outside off, 136kph and dabbed down into the ground wide of the keeper for one more

in the air, out towards deep midwicket, surely the breakthrough for Ireland... but it's dropped! De Kock pulled towards Anderson, running to his right, looked a pretty straightforward chance but he spilled it, sending the ball into the rope for four to compound the error
round the wicket, flighted outside off, Bavuma skips out and lofts over cover, that's the 150 partnership between the openers
uses the feet and punches one down the ground
slightly short from Dockrell, there to hit but it was cut off well
skips out and chips over the infield, looks to be running away to the deep extra cover boundary but Poynter does very well with a sliding dive to flick the ball back
pushed through on the stumps, tapped away
tossed up and worked through mid-on for one more down the ground
angled across the lefty from over the wicket, chopped into the ground and fielded in the covers
bit of width, de Kock opens the face and slides a couple more wide of third man
goes back in the cease and slaps one more through point
fuller, nurdled off the pads
length ball in the channel, de Kock frees the arms and strikes it straight to backward point

cramped for room, plays across the line... bowled him! Quinny falls 18 short of a century, bit of an inside edge and the ball flicked the top of leg stump. Good, tight line from KOB and Ireland finally get one, no need to rely on a catcher
tossed up on the stumps and worked for one to short fine leg
floated up outside off, punched back to the bowler
drives squarer this time, opening the face as he comes forward to get off the makr
flighted, Bavuma comes forward, chips over the infield again, just one to deep extra cover
flatter and blocked in front of middle and off
tossed up on off stump and du Plessis prods into the covers
tight lines again, outside off and chopped towards point
pitched up a bit more and du Plessis drives through the covers to the sweeper
taking the pace off, 113kph and Bavuma pats ti back down the pitch
rising off a length outside off, bit of width and Bavuma slices a shot behind point, in the air briefly and KOB raises his hands towards his head
mistimed, full and prodded back off a leading edge
pitched up, 121kph in the slot, nice-looking drive from du Plessis but it's cut off at extra cover
tosses the ball up slightly wide, Bavuma goes at it cross-batted and drags one to long-off
pushed through on middle and leg, worked square and they pinch one more
flat and quick on off, blocked
starts to move forward and Dockrell pushes his line wider, Bavuma swats at the ball and gets it between point and extra cover for one
tossed up and punched firmly but extra cover stoops to grab on the move
pushed through and du Plessis again can't force it through the off-side ring
short outside off and Bavum is up on his toes to cut, brilliant bit of fielding at point prevents a run
straighter line and Bavuma works through midwicket
touch back of a length around off, punched towards point
decent line from Chase, again du Plessis pokes the ball square on the off side
dug in halfway down, swivels on the pull, struck well but there's a man at deep midwicket

good length, not quite short enough for the cut, Bavuma whirls after it like the proverbial dervish and is not in control of a thick top edge that nevertheless sails wide of the keeper and bounces for four. Chase, who had Bavuma dropped on 1, looks cheesed off
tossed up and worked back down the ground
looped towards leg stump and Bavuma works off the pads, midwicket misfields
tossed up in the channel, comes forward and drives one more through the covers
flatter on off, Bavuma can't get it away
flighted, on the front foot, pushed back to the bowler
pushed through outside off, drops back and cuts one more through square
lovely stuff from Temba, gets a couple of steps in early, Chase drops short but he's round-housed through midwicket for four
sprays this one wide on the off side
better line, poked back into the covers
shuffles across early again, Chase goes wide and Bavuma steers through point to go into the 90s
pitched up and du Plessis is forward to pinch a couple through the covers
slightly back of a length, opens the face and glances behind the diving Porterfield at backward point
130kph and rising up outside off, driven off the back foot to cover
driven in the ground and Stirling can only get fingertips on it at extra cover
full outside off, forced along the ground to mid-off
excellent line from Murtagh, nagging away on off, punched into the covers
slightly full on off, Bavuma strokes a drive down the ground but mid-off is covering that area again
length ball, tapped down into the covers, Bavuma again can't get away
excellent line and length from 'Dial M' (for Murtagh) and Bavuma drops it in front of point, stays stuck on 90
short and wide from KOB and it's slapped in front of extra cover for Faf's first boundary
extra bounce this time, that rockets off a length, du Plessis swaying out of the way
bit of width, stays back and steers one through point
good length on off, Bavuma stabs the ball into the covers
shortish, wide outside off, Bavuma had moved across but fails to connect swinging hard, nearly off his feet as Wilson takes smartly
full and straight, can't get it away through midwicket - nine balls on 90 for TB now
slightly back of a length, chopped through point from deep in the crease
pitched up and Bavuma opens his shoulders, clubs over mid-on and away, gets him moving again though not the cleanest of strikes
slightly short, swung over the leg side, the crowd like that... but deep midwicket keeps them to one
length ball, jumps a little on du Plessis, who rides it and runs one behind point - that's the SA 200 up, to hoots and cheers
good length outside off, times the square drive in front of Porterfield throwing himself forward from point
comes across and taps another single out to the man in the deep
comes forward and drives to cover
pitched up and punched down the ground for one
sliding in with the arm, deflected for one off the pads
good length outside off, dabbed down into the covers

lofted over the infield, the crowd think this is going to the rope... yes, the dive at deep extra cover is in vain, nicely timed hitting on the up and that's the hundred on debut for Bavuma, only the second SA batsman to do so
shortish outside off, overbalances as he swings and misses - couldn't get to it
on the stumps and whipped away through midwicket for one more
tossed up outside off, can't get this through
uses the feet, chips over the off side and gets a couple more into the deep
speared in on the stumps, Bavuma swings across the line and gets a bit lucky, edging past his stumps
drops a touch short outside off, cuts but can't get it through
full and flighted, heaves across the line for one to deep midwicket
beautiful stroke, straight as an arrow back down the ground for four! Only a fraction overpitched from Dockrell but Bavuma swung gracefully through the line
full and swerving in to hit the pads as du Plessis tried to make room, heading down leg
length outside off, Bavuma throws the bat and gets a top edge to third man

cross-batted slug, straight up in the air... and well held by Porterfield at backward point! Du Plessis perishes trying to hit the accelerator, chunky top edge and it went a long way up, the captain steadied himself underneath the ball and bags a second wicket for Ireland
beaten outside off, doesn't quite get up, trying to force it off the back foot
worked from off stump through the leg side, good placement between deep midwicket and deep square
a slower short ball, well bowled, Bavuma is through his shot early
tapped into the leg side
uses his feet, gets very close to the ball, flicks it down to long-on
round the wicket, he tries to heave this over the leg stump but cloths it down the ground to long-on

big appeal for lbw has Duminy plays the reverse sweep, Dockrell almost begging, and eventually Porterfield opts to review. Remember, tweaked DRS for the first time today. More for the bowler to work with. Have to confirm he hasn't hit it first. Any glove? The zoomer is out. Hard to say so far. Well, has that scratched the glove? Very close, and a little mark on snicko. Yep, third umpire says glove. Not out
goes back to a shorter ball and drives to cover
very full, squeezed out to the off side, another dot and that's a good end to Dockrell's spell
good length at off stump, defended towards the bowler who diverts in his follow through
opens the face and guides this behind point
and his innings is over! Trying to press on. Goes to heave a back-of-a-length ball over the leg side and it is miscued high into the off, allowing cover to settle underneath it
very short outside off, loops through to the keeper...he'll get that ball again
full and that's a lovely drive through the covers, places it through the ring and wide of the sweeper
dabbed down to third man
full at middle and off, defended to mid-off
well bowled, no width to work with, Duminy can only it play it down by his feet...bounced a touch more than he expected
good pressure, on middle and leg, Duminy can't beat midwicket
and another dot, he'll feel he missed out here, was full on the pads and he again flicked it straight to midwicket
gets this through the covers as he comes forward and drives
very tight over as this is defended to point...just the single from it
slower ball, outside leg, worked into square leg
worked behind point to get off the mark
goes for the short ball again and like earlier it's far too short and loopy outside off
full and straight, Duminy giving the man at midwicket plenty of work in the last few overs
drives a full delivery to mid-off
driven through the off side to the cover sweeper
this slips out as a big full toss which Miller can only jab into the off side
length ball outside off, Duminy can't beat point
uses his feet then drags a short-of-a-length ball from outside off to deep midwicket...just the single
beats the outside as this one slides across him, trying to steer it down to third man
tight on off stump, defended straight down the pitch
walks across the crease and works this from off stump to midwicket as another dot stacks up
back of a length, nudges this just wide of the man at midwicket for scampered single
driven nicely through the off side, placed wide of the sweeper
flicks the pad down the leg side, Wilson dives to his right to prevent any runs
that will relieve some of the pressure that has been building, offered plenty of width and drives between cover and mid-off
straightens his line, this takes the thigh pad into the leg side
full and straight, bottom hand comes into play as he flicks to midwicket...he can't get going
punches a length ball down the ground to long-on
angled across outside off, he opens the face down to third man
works this off the stumps to deep midwicket...South Africa's 250 is up, but has taken longer than looked likely half an hour ago
manages to break free, and in good style, shuffles down the pitch then hammers a skimming, lofted drive over mid-off and clean into the advertising boards
that's gone a bit wrong, sprayed way down the leg side
back of a length outside off, crunched to the covers, it's parried by Stirling as he dives
that's middled! Made a lovely sound off the bat as Miller pings another cover drive, all along the ground, between cover and mid-off
straighter, on off stump, uses the angled into him from round the wicket and flicks to deep midwicket
gets the line wrong, drifts into the pads, deflects fine of the keeper...not bat, but still the same result for South Africa
good catch! pushed across outside off, Miller aims another booming drive, gets a thin nick which Wilson grabs standing up to the stumps
shuffles across the crease and tucks his first ball into the square-leg area
back of a length, punched down the ground
wide outside off, would have been called, but Behardien caught up with it and got a toe end
very full outside off, dug out to cover
round the wicket, on a length at off stump, tapped towards backward point and that would have been close with a direct hit
super shot, opens up his stance a touch then drives on the up over the covers, places it wide of the sweeper
angled onto leg stump, flicked off his toes to long leg who fumbles and gives away a second...another blot on Ireland's fielding copybook
oh dear, that slips out as a big full toss...and it's called no-ball for height. Behardien managed to shovel it to the leg side
round the wicket, short of a length, Duminy pulls it over midwicket but it's not timed very well and long-on cleans up
terrific batting as he goes over the off side, gets underneath the delivery which was short of yorker length and places it perfectly
very similar stroke, this time it goes squarer and deep cover is able to get around
length ball, goes to pull it to the leg side, from almost a crouched position, gets a bottom edge into his pads
heaves a full ball from outside off over wide midwicket, didn't come out of the middle, long-on can get around
short ball this time, pulled through square leg, deep midwicket runs to his left...scampering all round in these last few overs
this time he finds the gap, a slower ball dragged down on the pads, he waits just long enough then swivels on his pull behind square. Bisects long leg and deep midwicket
goes full and straight in response, driven firmly to long-off, almost straight to the man but they still make a second
another brace to end the over as he drives this through the covers and long-off as to move to his right
worked off the pads in front of square
pushes a length ball down to long-on to raise South Africa's 300...they have pushed on for the last 50 runs after that slow period
slugged into the leg side, no timing but the lack of pace on the ball allows them back easily for the second
back of a length on leg stump, he's through his shot early and it comes off the pads to the off side...a cutter from Murtagh
gets some fortune here as he swings at a back-of-a-length ball and gets a top edge which loops over short third man...the fielder does well to flick to back to prevent the boundary
chopped towards point and there's another run given away as it bursts through the hands of Poynter
full at off stump, swung down the ground to long-on. Back in a flash for the second
poor delivery, barely hit the cut strip, parried to short third man by a diving Wilson
well bowled, gets his yorker in, Behardien can only dig it out
just misses the yorker by a fraction outside off, but takes the bottom of the hand towards cover
full at the stumps, clubbed along the ground to deep square leg
this goes wrong, a wide full toss outside off, and it's a brilliant, one-handed, take by Wilson as he sticks his right glove out and gathers it on the half volley
that would have been wide as well, but he chases it and gets an edge fine of short third man instead...brings up the fifty stand off 30 balls

offers up a length ball to end the over, Behardien is able to get underneath it with the leverage to clear long-on...what looked a decent over from O'Brien ends up a good one for South Africa. Solid crowd catch.
lovely stroke, that's very classy, lofts a full delivery from outside off over the covers and finds the gap between the deep fielders at cover and long-off
gives himself a touch of room to the leg side then heaves this from around off stump over midwicket
comes down the pitch, Chase pulls his length back, Duminy flat-bats it out to deep cover to reach fifty off 41 balls, he's caught up superbly after struggling for his timing early on
full and wide outside off, driven powerfully through the covers, the sweeper just manages to cut it off
swings a straight delivery to deep midwicket
slower ball outside off, finds cover on the edge of the circle

caught, but beyond the boundary! That's just got the legs to clear deep midwicket as he gets well underneath a length delivery. Porterfield wasn't quite sure where the boundary was and stood on the marker as he held the catch
driven in the air over cover
back of a length and he pulls this over the deep square-leg boundary...poor delivery, really. Got to go full
length outside off, pushed through the covers and takes Behardien to a 21-ball fifty. He's played very well
wide outside off but he opts for the leg side, gets a thick bottom edge towards short fine leg
can't quite finish it in style, tries to clear deep midwicket but doesn't quite have the power and the catch is safely held

inn2.comm: straight through him, fast and bouncy from over the wicket, beats Porterfield on the inside

too quick again, coming back in towards off stump, did that flick the pad on its way through? Radaba thought so... and so did Joel Wilson! The finger went up after a moment's consideration, and Porterfield decides to review... Time for DRS (though this isn't really a test of the new system, since it only needed to be clipping either way), the ball was pitching in line, point of impact umpire's call... and clipping the top corner of off stump! It's about as close as it gets but there'll be no reprieve, Rabada striking second ball
good length, slightly wide of the stumps to the right-hander, left alone
beaten this time, fencing at the ball in the channel, too quick for fresh meat
slightly back of a length, 137kph and left alone outside off this time
pitched up, full and enticing, 142kph and Anderson again fails to get bat on it. Wicket-maiden to start with for Rabada... It's not getting any easier
over the wicket to the right-handed Stirling, good length, maybe a hint of movement back in, lets it go
pitched up a little further, comes forward to poke a drive in mid-off's direction
shorter and straighter, 137kph on the stumps, worked to leg
past the outside edge this time, Stirling reaching for the drive and beaten
lovely timing, using the pace of Parnell, 140kph but just cushioned out of the middle of the bat coming forwards, races in front of square for Ireland's first runs
straighter, waits in the crease and nudges a single to leg to keep the strike
slightly short and hammered through point, a brilliant back-foot bosh from Stirling, lands another blow for Ireland
better line from Rabada, quick and straightening through outside off, draws his bat inside
similar ball, 140 clicks and climbing through outside off stump, left alone
gets across his stumps, 141kph and blocked towards cover point, a squiggly bounce does the fielder
short ball, a heat-seeker at the top of Anderson's bonce, he pulls/pulls out, nothing on it
pitched up this time and Anderson drives at it unsuccessfully without foot movement
full on the stumps, stroked back down the pitch, Parnell gets a hand on it
shorter length, goes for the tuck to leg and gets a leading edge, spoons towards mid-on but lands safely
down the leg side at 138kph
good length, 141kph around the line of off, Anderson steers it cautiously to point
pitched up and bit further, at a good lick from Parnell, a tentative drive flies off the outside edge to third man - Anderson off the mark
shortens his length, defended securely from the crease
shortish outside off and guided down to third man for one more
woof! Only slightly overpitched from Rabada but it is absolutely creamed through the covers by Stirling, easing the weight forwards and nailing the drive
banged in but sliding leg side, pull and a miss
shaping away outside off this time... but wide again
on the body and tucked through midwicket for one
good length outside off, 137kph and Anderson moves a little more freely into this one, steering a push to third man
rib-tickler from Rabada, 142kph this time, Stirling coolly works it off his body behind square
full on the stumps, Anderson glances off his legs and a misfield in the deep by Pretorius gifts them a second
shortish on the stumps and worked through backward square for one

short ball, Anderson swats a pull high into the sky, big top edge - and Rabada holds on at fine leg! Never really looked comfortable against this sort of pace bowling (fine margins again) and he couldn't control the shot, Ireland lose their second batsman
defended into the off side on the back foot
shot! Stays in the crease and drills another boundary through cover point, Stirling looking in good nick here
pitched up on off stump, presses forward to block
straighter line, worked off the legs into a gap and they hustle through
angled across, slightly back of a length, blocked into the off side
Stirling ducks away from the bouncer
length ball, 142kph and defended coming forwards
driven down the ground, good timing as he gets into line and pushes back past the bowler for three

squirted behind square, there's an appeal for a catch... Duminy, I think. Bump ball? The umpires are going to check... But it's an easy decision, the ball coming off the face of Wilson's bat and bouncing several inches away before flying to the fielder. The Specsavers ad on the big screen hangs there, mockingly, before it conks out and Joel Wilson signals to continue
on the body and worked to leg, Wilson up and running
sprays another one down the leg side
another spitting bouncer from Rabada, again Stirling cranks his head out of the way
slightly back of a length outside off, swish and a miss from Wilson, too close to cut
pitched up, 137kph and punched towards extra cover coming forwards
on the stumps, clipped along the carpet towards mid-on
touch short outside off, 139kph and Wilson gets an inside edge on to his front pad
slightly leg side, 142 clicks this time, flicks the pads on its way through to the keeper
good bouncer to finish with, Wilson flinches underneath it... and that's a maiden for Parnell
;length outside off, but if width for Stirling to carve one to third man
length around off stump, defended coming forwards

tight single this...! Dabbed down wide of slip and Stirling has to scamper for the striker's end, the fielder moving across quickly and throwing right-handed. Needed a direct hit, instead it struck Stirling
comes across on off stump and taps back down the wicket
back of a length ball, 122kph and punched firmly but can't get it past cover
pitched up a bit more, pressed into the covers
slightly short of a length outside off, Wilson guides it down to third man
in the channel, 131kph, Stirling drops back and angles the bat for another single to third man
pitched up and blocked into the covers as Wilson gets forward
full, angling in at 133kph, punched along the ground to mid-on
moves across outside off early doors, Phehlukwayo maintains a good length, 137kph and all he can do is defend it down into the off side
beats him with the final ball of the over, good carry through as Wilson tried to dab to third man again
Stirling moves across outside off and runs another single to third man
good length, 125kph in the channel, Wilson again can't do anything useful with it

bangs in the short ball, Wilson swipes across the line - and nicks to the keeper! Maiden international wicket for Pretorius, he celebrates as the finger goes up. Wilson was trying to battle through but his torpid innings is over
digs in another bouncer, directed at the head, O'Brien ducks it
back of a length but this shoots through low as KOB stays in the crease and wafts unsuccessfully
ooh, where is it Kevin...? "It's behind you!" KOB is left looking side to side as he defends a ball down between his legs but it doesn't end up rolling towards the stumps
pitched up, 133kph and driven on the walk towards mid-off
dug in, Stirling rather flaps at a pull, gets a top edge but it won't quite carry into fine leg's ballpark
pitched up on middle and leg, punched to mid-on
full and drifting on to the pads, this is played with a little more give in the wrists and KOB gets off the mark through midwicket
pitched up and driven firmly towards mid-off
banged in short and Stirling again swings a pull down towards fine leg
Stirling opens the face and runs one more to third man
comes across and punches on the up, can't get it past extra cover
full on off, 125kph and driven but without great timing to mid-off
short ball, does quite get up as much as O'Brien was expecting and he is through the shot, hit on the back as he turns towards midwicket
pitched up and flicked off the legs to the man on the edge of the circle
another short ball, again misses out with the pull, deflects off the shoulder to the keeper - Pretorius enquired but no bat involved
lovely ball from Phehlukwayo, shaping away past the outside edge as Stirling tries to drive off the back foot again
bit of width, chopped into the ground and through to de Kock
goes back on off stump and slides one more to third man
can't stop those so easily, though, touch full and O'Brien steps across to stroke a crisp straight drive back past the umpire for a welcome boundary
four more, punched past mid-off! KOB shows some of the power that Mike was invoking, crunching another slightly overpitched ball down the ground
three in a row, edged wide of the keeper! Frustration for Phehlukwayo, not where the batsman was intending it to go but they all count
short outside off and Stirling gives it some bally-ho over the covers, a real fly ball but it clears the ring and the fielders giving chase for couple
comes forward and presses into the off side
length outside off, comes across and steers another single to third man
lovely stuff from KOB, who's picked up four boundaries from his last four balls, stepping out to leather through the covers
pitched up and worked off the toes through midwicket
good length around off stump and pushed into the covers
on the stumps and flicked through midwicket for a single
dug in short, looping through above the attempted pull... Gets away with one for the over
hold the pose! Stirling playing that booming drive on the up, sails in the air over point and there's no one anywhere near the ball when it lands
dug in, KOB ignores the short ball
goes after this, trying to hit on the up, slices a drive over cover running back
on the stumps and Stirling shuffles into line, nudges behind square for one more
drives out to the cover sweeper
back of a length outside off, defended to point
width outside off, slapped to deep cover
a neat back-foot punch, he's timed some of his drives nicely, finds the sweeper again
short outside off, he goes for the pull but is through his shot and doesn't make contact
connects nicely with this one, another short ball, but not quite as high this time, O'Brien meets it with a sweetly-struck hook
and strikes first ball! Stirling sweeps at a very full ball, goes under the bat, strikes the front pad, and that looked straight at first look...Stirling's battling effort is over
defended to the leg side
leans forward and blocks on the front foot
touch shorter, steered to the covers
goes back outside leg stump and drives a short delivery to deep cover
pushed into the off side
pushed across outside off, left alone
that's a lovely stroke, stands tall and drives a back-of-a-length delivery through the covers
gets inside the line and works a short-of-a-length delivery off his hip behind square
a bouncer, over leg stump, and the umpire decides it's too short
full outside off, driven strongly off the front foot wide of cover and the sweeper can't stop the second
full, pings a drive straight to mid-off
he's good against the short ball, latches on again and pulls this handsomely behind square
driven to cover
touch shorter, he goes back and cuts, gets a thick top edge well wide of the keeper and fine of short third man
fuller, defended to the off side
steps back and cut to point
gets a stride forward and defends
angled in with the arm, Terry moves to leg to try and open up the off side, drives to deep cover
comes round the wicket, serves up a half volley outside off and gets dispatched through the covers with a thudding drive
straightens the line and pulls the length back a touch, still a drive ball but it goes back to the bowler
short, pulled through midwicket
length ball outside off, opens the face to third man

another short ball and this one brings a wicket! Terry shaped up okay for the pull, picked the length early, but didn't keep the ball down and neither did it have the legs to clear the boundary. Instead a simple catch to deep square leg
off the mark with a lovely piece of timing as he punches a back-of-a-length delivery off the back foot square through cover
short outside off, cut in front of square to deep cover
forces this off the back foot with a slightly open face and finds short third man
full and straight, patted to the off side
brings out the sweep, is more successful than Stirling's effort, the ball is a touch shorter, sends it flat through square leg
very full at off stump, driven to long-off

that's a lovely piece of timing and placement, although the boundary is ultimately helped by being palmed across the rope by Bavuma running round from deep cover, but the shot was a smart piece of batting as he lofted it with an open face over cover
whipped down to long-on
fuller, flicked down the ground
works a straight ball to midwicket
touch shorter, he goes back in the crease but then picks out cover as he drives

oh dear! It wasn't a great delivery, a shortish ball outside off, Poynter could see the chance to score through the off side, he rocked back but then ended up just spooning a catch to mid-off. Perhaps a hint of turn played a part
defended into midwicket
full from round the wicket, a pleasant drive to the left of long-off but swift work by Miller keeps them to a single
onto the front foot and drives down the ground
angled into the pads, deflects to short fine leg
nudged square into the leg side
defended to the off side
pushed firmly into the covers
hint of turn, takes the front pad to the leg side
shorter delivery, driven off the back foot to long-on
pushed back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, driven in the air over the covers, deep cover is able to get around
wide line outside off, he leans forward and pushes square

and another for JP! O'Brien goes for a paddle-sweep and just offers a dolly of a catch to short fine leg. Bounced a touch more which meant it took more top edge than middle and he couldn't keep it down
pushed towards mid-on
driven strongly down the ground to long-off
over the wicket to the left hander, beats the outside with a ball that doesn't turn
flicked from outside off down to long-on
touch shorter, pushed into the covers
connects nicely with this, dropped in short, Dockrell is quick on his feet to go back then pulls over mid-on
round the wicket, flicked off the pads to deep square
sweeps to short fine leg
short outside off, driven from the back foot to cover who makes a guiding save
uses his feet then clips into midwicket
has this reached the fielder at long-on?! No, just short by the looks of it. Dockrell lofts it down the ground, Rabada makes good ground in but can't quite get there
a wide down the leg side and a sharp attempt at a stumping chance but Murtagh is able to keep a foot behind the line
pushed to mid-on
short outside off, cut firmly to deep cover
that's a terrific shot, uses his feet then chip-drives over mid-off and Miller can't flick back despite a good effort to get across from long-on
worked into midwicket
spins down the leg side, was there a tickle? De Kock couldn't glove it. Might have been a little touch
round the wicket, more nice footwork and another lofted drive, this time straight down the ground, for another boundaru
whipped off the pads to midwicket
wide outside off, driven to cover
comes down the pitch and drives to the left of mid-off who makes goods ground to cut-off

dropped, and that's a very average piece of cricket. Nicely bowled by Duminy, who tossed it slightly wider, which meant Murtagh had to reach for it and sent a simple chance to long-off. It popped out of Rabada's hands for no reason other than he took his eyes off it
pushed to the off side
short and swung behind square on the leg side
punched to mid-off
driven in the air, square through the off side
goes back to pull, the ball skids on, perhaps wasn't quite short enough in truth for the shot and demolishes the stumps
driven to the off side
flicked into midwicket
prodded to the leg side
comes forward and drives to the cover ring
down the pitch and drives to deep cover
swift work down the leg side from de Kock to try and get a stumping...think the batsman is okay, but we'll see. Yep, he keeps a foot firmly ground
getting some decent revs on the ball, this spins quite sharply into Young and takes the pad
cleaned him up! That's reward for tossing it up. Grips, turns back through the gate as Young aims to the leg side and strikes top of leg stump. Easy as you like. Three for JP
and that's that! As quickly as that it's all over. Chase pulls his first ball limply to midwicket as Duminy finishes it with two in two balls
